comments.c: Just 2 things. When you open just pop the lid barely it opens itself. Forcing can break the gears. 2nd for applying use transfer tape to apply and keep the lettering straight
This machine is so cool! Now this will always be on my mind on the list of stuff I'd like to have
Transfer tape will make things so much easier and neater
Very helpful video! I was wondering if I should invest in a Maker 3. This helped alot!

I’ve been curious about the Cricut four years. In this video you took some of the mystery out… Thank you for that! I would love to be able to use this sort of machine in my sewing room!  Beautifully concise video
Wow. I'm sewing for 45 years and didn't have any idea that devise like this was ever created! Thanks.
Any idea if there is a circut tool that will cut fabric using heat to prevent it from fraying?

Do you have a free Cricut Account or do you pay for the monthly subscription?

I've been researching both the Cricut & Silhouette brands for over a year & the Design Space subscription fee has been one of the reasons I hadn't gotten one yet.

Thank you for your video! I don't feel alone now in saying I'm such a beginner at this, which makes me hesitate, but I just gotta take the first step just like others did. I would love to get a cricut machine of my own.
So amazing! Thank you for sharing this video… from Tokyo
